clinical_study.brief_title: Glucose Metabolism Disorders and Metabolic Syndrome Before and After Primary Hip and Knee Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Hyperglycemia in Joint Replacement Recipients: Glucose Metabolism Disorders and Metabolic Syndrome in Osteoarthritis Patients Before and After Primary Hip and Knee Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: Osteoarthritis patients undergoing primary hip and knee replacement are followed-up and changes in their glucose metabolism and other metabolic parameters (obesity, cholesterol levels) are examined. Persistent postoperative pain is examined as secondary outcome.

detailed_description.textblock: Glucose metabolism disorders (diabetes and pre-diabetes) and metabolic syndrome are common in joint replacement recipients. Improved physical activity following joint replacement could lead to better glucose control in diabetes and ameliorate impaired glucose and cholesterol levels. In this study patients previously recruited to "Perioperative Hyperglycaemia in Primary Total Hip and Knee Replacement" study are being followed-up for one year in order to analyze if joint replacements have an effect on these metabolic abnormalities. In addition, the effect of glucose metabolism disorders on occurrence of persistent pain after surgery is analyzed.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Primary researcher not able to continue research at the moment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in glucose tolerance, measured using oral glucose tolerance test
primary_outcome.description: The patients are grouped into three groups that are evaluated 12, 18 and ca. 24 months after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cholesterol levels (HDL, LDL, triglycerides)

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using visual analog scale. Patients are divided in three groups that are evaluated 12, 18 and 24 months after surgery.

other_outcome.measure: Change in plasma adipokine and cytokine concentrations

arm_group.description: Hip and knee replacement recipients (with osteoarthritis) enrolled previously into "Perioperative Hyperglycaemia in Primary Total Hip and Knee Replacement" study (NCT01021826).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary hip and knee replacement for osteoarthritis
- Enrolled previously into study NCT01021826
Exclusion Criteria:
- Arthritis other than osteoarthritis (based on study NCT01021826)
- Medication affecting glucose metabolism (excl. antidiabetic agents) (based on study NTC01021826)
- Died before follow-up phase
- Did not undergo the planned hip or knee replacement
